/wiki/Shing_Chung_Chan: Shing Chung Chan is a paralympic athlete from Hong Kong competing mainly in category C8 sprint events . Shing Chung competed in four Paralympics , winning five medals , four of them in relay events . His first games were in 1988 where he competed in the 200m and long jump and won a bronze medal in the 4 × 100 m relay . The 1992 Summer Paralympics saw Shing Chung win a silver medal in the 100m individual event and raced in the 4 × 100 m relay . The 1996 Summer Paralympics led to Shing Chung 's only gold medal and a world record as part of the Hong Kong 4 × 100 m relay team , he again also raced in the 100m and 200m . His final games in 2000 saw him win 2 bronze medals as part of the Hong Kong 4 × 100 m and 4 × 400 m teams as well as racing in the 100m .
/wiki/Wa_Wai_So: So Wa Wai ( ; born October 6 , 1981 ) is a retired athlete from Hong Kong who has competed in the Paralympic Games on four occasions , winning 11 medals .
/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1996_Summer_Paral: Athletics at the 1996 Summer Paralympics consisted of 210 events , 155 for men and 55 for women .
/wiki/Wheelchair_fencing_at_the_1996_Sum: Wheelchair fencing at the 1996 Summer Paralympics consisted of 15 events , 9 for men and 6 for women .
/wiki/Lawn_bowls_at_the_1996_Summer_Para: Lawn bowls at the 1996 Summer Paralympics consisted of eight events .
/wiki/Table_tennis_at_the_1996_Summer_Pa: Table tennis at the 1996 Summer Paralympics consisted of 28 events , 17 for men and 11 for women .
/wiki/Pui_Yi_Wong: Wong Pui Yi ( Chinese : 黃佩儀 , born 31 May 1961 ) is a Hong Kong para table tennis player . She won a gold medal at the 1992 Summer Paralympics and two silver medals at the 1996 Summer Paralympics . She was diagnosed with polio when she was one year old . She began playing in 1979 .
